snippet: The Federal Reserve opened the door for China's biggest bank to establish a presence in the United States on Wednesday, allowing the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China to buy an American institution.
abstract: The Federal Reserve opened the door for China's biggest bank to establish a presence in the United States on Wednesday, allowing the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China to buy an American institution.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Fed Approves I.C.B.C.'s Takeover of Bank of East Asia
